page.title: 11Housing In Albrugh
page.content: { HOUSEING { Some houses in the area date back to the fourteeth and 15 C These are built from wooden frames with lathe and plaster infilling. The smaller cottages until the 18 C were built mainly of clay lump. Some brick council houses built in 3 rows of four or six houses stand in large gardens were many vegitables are grown for the family. The newest extension, built 20 years ago is a ribbon development in the center of the village, consisting of brick built bungalows and chalet bungalows. Most dwellings have the following rooms and some gardens. 2/3/4 bedrooms,bathroom,kitchen lavatory, living room/Dining room
